page.title: 01Kington :Gazetteer
page.content: Kington is in the county of Hereford and Worcester. Its population is just under 2000. It is the smallest of the six Herefordshire market towns. Market day is Thursday. The market is mainly concerned with sheep. There is a great variety of shops because there is no competion from surrounding areas. Examples of shops include furniture, pet shop, hardware, foodshops and clothes shops which also sell make up and jewellery. The trouser factory is the biggest employer, mosty of women. The golf course on Bradnor Hill is the highest in England and Wales. Hergest Croft Gardens attract many visitors in summer. Offa's Dyke is close to the town and brings many keen walkers to the town. However, tourists generally pass through Kington on their way to Wales, just stopping eg for a meal rather than for a holiday.
